title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Demonstrate Kiota client usage patterns!

1. Show the Kiota CLI command to generate a client:
   - Language: CSharp
   - Output: ./BookstoreClient
   - Document: https://api.bookstore.com/openapi.json
   - Client name: BookstoreApiClient
   - Namespace: Bookstore.Client

2. Write code that demonstrates using a generated client:
   - Set up authentication provider and adapter
   - Create the API client
   - GET all books
   - GET single book by ISBN
   - POST create new book
   - Search books with query parameters
   - Handle 404 error gracefully

3. Print the benefits of using Kiota over manual HttpClient

hints.text: AnonymousAuthenticationProvider is for public APIs without authentication.
HttpClientRequestAdapter takes auth provider and needs BaseUrl set.
Path parameters use indexer: client.Books[isbn] not client.Books(isbn).

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to set BaseUrl on adapter
commonMistakes.consequence: Requests go to wrong URL or fail completely.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using () instead of [] for path parameters
commonMistakes.consequence: Compile error. Kiota uses indexer syntax for path params.
commonMistakes.correction: Use client.Books[id] not client.Books(id) for path parameters.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not regenerating client after API changes
commonMistakes.consequence: Client is out of sync with API. Runtime errors or missing endpoints.
commonMistakes.correction: Run 'kiota update -o ./Client' after API changes or add to CI/CD pipeline.
